column4: hi i'm very new to ubuntu can anyone tell me a command to determine if the machine i'm using is 64 or 32 bits, or where to look for this info?
cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep flags, see if there is the "lm" flag
i don't know about lahf_lm, but "lm" means your processor is 64bit
one thing is saying that you're *running* the 32-bit version of Ubuntu, another thing is saying that you *have* a 64-bit processor. you asked about the latter.
